**Solicitation Description:**

Employment and Social Development Canada (EDSC) is seeking a consultant to conduct a summative evaluation of the Community Services Recovery Fund (CSRF). The evaluation will assess the program’s design against its intended outcomes and inform future policy direction. The consultant will apply Gender-Based Analysis Plus (GBA+) to evaluate the extent to which the fund engaged community service organizations serving and led by diverse, intersecting, and equity-deserving communities.

The consultant will be responsible for:

* Developing an evaluation methodology report outlining the proposed design for the summative evaluation
* Preparing data collection instruments for each line of evidence
* Collecting and analyzing data
* Creating technical reports for each line of evidence
* Writing a summative evaluation report
* Completing outstanding lines of evidence and delivering all remaining outputs by March 31st, 2025

**Security Requirements:**

The contractor must hold a valid Designated Organization Screening (DOS) with approved document safeguarding at the level of protected B, issued by the Contract Security Program (CSP), Public Works and Government Services Canada (PWGSC). Contractor personnel requiring access to protected information, assets, or work sites must hold a valid Reliability Status granted or approved by the CSP, PWGSC.
